intro: Garnotia patula var. patula, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It features showy, tubular purple to pink flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant has lance-shaped, hairy leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its botanical characteristics include a taproot system and the ability to spread through rhizomes.
